snippet: With knee injuries for Baron Davis, Jeremy Lin and Iman Shumpert, it has been a playoff season of agony for the Knicks, and no one can speak to the repercussions better than Bernard King, now an analyst for the MSG Network.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column holds that with knee injuries for New York Knicks guards Baron Davis, Jeremy Lin and Iman Shumpert, it has been a playoff season of agony for the Knicks; notes that no one knows better than former Knicks forward Bernard King, now an MSG Network analyst; recalls that after sustaining major knee ligament damage in 1985, King took nearly two years of rehabilitation before returning to action. Photo (M)h
lead_paragraph: Greenburgh, N.Y. Anyone with a heart had to wince when Baron Davis's right knee was shredded last Sunday at Madison Square Garden in Game 4 of the Knicks' playoff series against the Miami Heat. Having once been exactly where Davis was, collapsed in a terrified heap, Bernard King had an even more visceral response.
